Posted By: Kevin Cummings
I pay shipping and insurance.

Posted By: Kevin Cummings
I figure a year is a reasonable amount of time before bumping your own thread! [IMG]https://www.net54baseball.com/images/wink.gif[/IMG]

Prices reduced. Come on guys, there's a card on ebay right now that's not nearly as nice as any of these three and that will get bought for more than I'm offering these for.

I'll also trade for anything on my Old Judge want list in a similar condition.

Posted By: Dave
What is your new asking price for the cards in the scans ?  There not particulary hard tio find Old Judges, and they look to be in pretty bad shape.  I would be interested in any Cincinnati or Pittsburgh or Louisville players you might have

Posted By: Joe_G.
FWIW, I wouldn't exactly call the three listed cards common, they aren't difficult by OJ standards but far from common.  I believe Kevin already marked the cards down, two SGC30s & an SGC10.  Not bad prices for graded OJs, just not on my want list.

Best Regards,
Joe Gonsowski

Posted By: Dave
You are right Joe, I meant that they were relatively common within the N172 set, but compared to other cards they surely aren't. I rarely buy graded Old Judges so I am not that familiar with the currrent market prices. I defer to collectors like yourself who are more knowledgeable about the 19th century issues. I just recently started collecting the N172 cards, and am still learning as I go
